Instavans APIs ​— ​Core APIs that deal with all business logic. 
Privileged to be the first full stack developer at the startup, my responsibilities included Designing & 
Developing REST APIs using NodeJS and relevant frameworks. These APIs are consumed by Native Mobile Apps 
as well as web panels in different projects. The APIs include complex problems which are industry prevalent in 
the Logistics Industry. 



Driver Trips ​— ​Panel to deal with driver trips and automated payments 
This tool was built to bring transparency and automation for billing of drivers. Tasks were to Simulate driver 
trip path, pick up and drop locations, halts on the map and allow payments department to toggle and compare 
path, distance, and earnings on the basis of several parameters. Tech used: AngularJS, Gulp, Google Maps APIs 
with the combination of core backend APIs described above. 

Driver Onboarding ​— ​Panel to help driver onboarding agents. 
The project helps onboarding agents to simplify problems while onboarding drivers. The tool can be compared 
with a tool that may help an HR for recruitment. But the scenario in the logistics industry is very different and 
therefore we had to come up with this tool. Tech used: LAMP Stack.

recommend similar places with the help of Artificial Intelligence.

2016. 
Developed a relocation tool which would allow users to take into account various factors before moving into a 
particular city. Users can see the crime rate, education rate, health-risk rate, etc of a particular place in the 
form of heat maps. Thus allowing users to relocate in a good neighborhood. 

Pragyan Hackathon 2015 Award ​— ​Won the prize for most Slick UI at Pragyan Hackathon - 
2015. 
Couldn’t win the hackathon but got awarded for the most beautiful and slick UI among all entries.

Description 
Goods and Service Tax (GST) is an indirect tax (or consumption tax) 
imposed in India on the supply of goods and services. It is a 

comprehensive multistage, destination based tax. Comprehensive 
because it has subsumed almost all the indirect taxes except few. 

Multi-Staged as it is imposed at every step in the production process, 

but is meant to be refunded to all parties in the various stages of 

production other than the final consumer. 
 

GSTR – 1 is a monthly or quarterly return filed by taxpayers to disclose details 
of their outward supplies for the month – along with their tax liability. Here, 
invoice-wise details are to be uploaded so that the Government can keep a 
check on every transaction. This forms the basis for the recipient of supplies 
to accept the same and take the eligible input tax credit. 
GSTR – 3B is a monthly summary return filed by a taxpayer by the 20th of 
the next month. GSTR-3B discloses supplies made during the month along 
with GST to be paid, input tax credit claimed, purchases on which reverse 
charge is applicable, etc., and also makes a provision for the payment of 
taxes, if any, for the relevant month.

techniques.

maintaining Existing validations to added more reliable codes.

General insurance or non-life insurance policies, including automobile

any insurance that is not determined to be life insurance . 
 

Motor vehicle insurance is the insurance coverage of the risk of third party 
arising out the use of motor vehicle and also for covering the risk of damage 
caused to the vehicle. Taking insurance policy for coverage of certain risks 
are made compulsory and coverage for other risks are optional at the 
instance of the owner. 
The word Motor broadly covers a lot of classes of vehicles plying on the 
roads. These may be two-wheelers like scooters and motorbikes, three- 
wheelers or four wheelers like private cars, jeeps, buses, trucks, commercial 
taxis and other vehicles. There are three types of motor insurance which has

PROJECT DETAIL:

Syndicate and JNK Bank (Java 1.7 or above, Eclipse, J2EE, MySql, Spring, Hibernate)
Description: Syndicate Project is based on Bank domain. It is Finance Inclusion Transaction project. This is an ONUS/OFFUS type of transaction. The BIO metric data (Finger print) of customer are captured for authentication. Authentication is done against local customer database of Syndicate bank. The biometric data is sent as an encrypted data, under the Key provided by Syndicate bank.
AEPS based transaction: The BIO metric data (Finger print) of customer are captured for authentication. The biometric data is sent as an encrypted data, under the standard defined by UIDAI.
PIN based transaction: The PIN data of customer is captured for authentication. The generated PIN Block (Format 0) is sent as an encrypted data. The POS device has been loaded with key to secure the PIN Block. TGKIT tool is used to inject the Initial key provided by Syndicate bank, in a very secure environment. A unique key per device is then remotely loaded into each device. The remote key used to encrypt the PIN block is communicated as an encrypted key (under initial key injected into the device).
Ekyc and Aadhar Seeding: Ekyc is done for customer to verify and then Aadhar is linked with Account in Syndicate bank.
